alert.note: Alert for Central Yampa River Basin; Flat Tops; Lower Yampa River Basin; Roan and Tavaputs Plateaus (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS GrandJunction (Western Colorado and Eastern Utah)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 02 at 7:19PM MDT by NWS GrandJunction
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of west central Garfield, western Moffat and western Rio Blanco Counties through 800 PM MDT... At 718 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 34 miles northeast of Dinosaur to 18 miles east of Rangely to 32 miles northwest of De Beque. Movement was northeast at 35 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Rangely, Massadona, Greystone and Elk Springs. This includes the following highways... U.S. Highway 40 in Colorado between mile markers 21 and 55. Colorado 64 between mile markers 30 and 58. Colorado 139 between mile markers 31 and 57. Colorado 318 between mile markers 25 and 54. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.

area.areaDesc: Central Yampa River Basin; Flat Tops; Lower Yampa River Basin; Roan and Tavaputs Plateaus
